etymology.description: Depicts a footprint pointing up with three toes and a sole -> stylized as 龰 (龰) (yù, 'component stylization')
etymology.interpretation: The character 龰 (龰) (yù, 'component stylization') stylizes the original pictogram of a foot with three toes and a sole, highlighting the upward orientation. This stylization serves as a basis for several other characters related to motion or elements related to feet.

examples.chinese: 这个汉字采用了精妙的龰(龰)，构法巧妙(構法巧妙)。
examples.pinyin: Zhège hànzì cǎiyòngle jīngmiào de yù(龰)，gòufǎ qiǎomiào(構法巧妙)。
examples.english: This Chinese character employs an exquisite yù component, and its construction is ingeniously designed.

examples.chinese: 书法家研究汉字中的龰(龰)，探讨部件的美学(探討部件的美學)。
examples.pinyin: Shūfǎjiā yánjiū hànzì zhōng de yù(龰)，tàn tǎo bùjiàn de měixué(探討部件的美學)。
examples.english: Calligraphers study the yù found in Chinese characters, exploring the aesthetics of component design.

examples.chinese: 古代篆刻作品常用龰(龰)，来凸显文字的精髓(凸顯文字的精髓)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔdài zhuànkè zuòpǐn cháng yòng yù(龰)，lái túxiǎn wénzì de jīngsuǐ(凸顯文字的精髓)。
examples.english: Ancient seal carvings often utilized the yù to highlight the essence of the characters.
